result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason D Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve second half of the sentence on Electronic Monitor if the defendant qualifies.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.

Pay restitution.  State is given 60 days to determine amount and provide to defense counsel for review.  Pay as established, if no objection. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with the victim, Christopher Klein.
Participate in any assessment or counseling recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason D Goodwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason D Goodwin in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
9:05 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  State moves to amend the charge to Disorderly Conduct pursuant to 947.01(1) a Class B Misdemeanor.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. No victims are present.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend to Disorderly Conduct. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Serve 90 days jail - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve second half of the sentence on Electronic Monitor, if he qualifies. 

Placed on probation for a period of 12 months: 
No contact with the victim, Christopher Klein. 
Participate in any assessment or counseling recommended by agent.
Pay restitution.  State is given 60 days to determine amount and provide to defense counsel for review.  Pay as established if no objection. 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.
No contact with Christopher Klein, directly or indirectly.

Defendant Jason D Goodwin in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
